title: Twitter
Loom
text:
Loom
To embed a Loom video in your HTML document use this shortcode:
{{< loom <VIDEO_ID> >}}
Where <VIDEO_ID> is the loom video ID. For example:
{{< loom 8619b03224f74282b6d56cbedbcd3fc6 >}}
Which renders like this:

You can get the VIDEO ID from for the URL of the video. For instance, in the URL https://www.loom.com/share/8619b03224f74282b6d56cbedbcd3fc6 the video ID is 8619b03224f74282b6d56cbedbcd3fc6.

title: GitHub gists
Bluesky
text:
Bluesky
To embed a Bluesky post into your Quarto html document you can use the shortcode like this:
{{< bsky <POST_ID> >}}
Where <POST_ID> is the Bluesky post ID from the URL. For example:
{{< bsky 3lgyb5za7bc2b >}}
Which is rendered like this:

You can obtain the post ID by inspecting Bluesky’s URLs.
For instance, in this URL, https://bsky.app/profile/sellorm.com/post/3lgyb5za7bc2b the post ID is the part after the last ‘/’ in the URL.

title: Quarto social embeds
text:
A Quarto extension to embed content from across the web into a quarto-rendered html document using a shortcode.
Currently includes shortcodes for the following:

GitHub gists
Loom
Mastodon
Twitter
Vimeo
Youtube



Install the extension with:
quarto install extension sellorm/quarto-social-embeds



Check the individual examples in the navbar above for specific examples.
This site was built using the extension, so the examples are actual working examples. Check the GitHub repo to see the site’s underlying .qmd files.



quarto-social-embeds is released under an MIT License. See the LICENSE for more info.

title: Quarto social embeds
text:
Install the extension with:
quarto install extension sellorm/quarto-social-embeds

title: social embedding examples
social embedding examples
social embedding examples
text:
GitHub gists
Here is a gist I wrote:
Uses the shortcode:
{{< gist sellorm 20525aff669acafb975b7495b8f2066e >}}

Gists can be pretty handy.

title: social embedding examples
text:
Mastodon
This is a post on mastodon
Uses this shortcode:
{{< mastodon "https://mastodon.social/@sellorm/109376707453406631" >}}






Note



You must enclose the Mastodon URL in quotes, or the post will not be displayed.


  
You can obtain the username and status id of a tweet by clicking the “share tweet” button and choosing “copy URL”.
This will give you a URL like this one: https://twitter.com/juliesquid/status/1557485909486059523. The “user” is the section between twitter.com/ and /status. The status “id” is everything between status/ and the end of the URL or ?, whichever comes first.

title: social embedding examples
text:

title: social embedding examples
text:
Vimeo
A video from Vimeo:
Uses the shortcode:
{{< vimeo 22439234 >}}
   
It’s very beautiful.

title: social embedding examples
text:
Youtube
This is a video I created for rstudio::conf(2022).
Uses the shortcode:
{{< youtube zk9zHqXm6m0 >}}

The video is about my R4Pi project.

title: Youtube
text:
Youtube
To embed a Youtube video into your Quarto html document you can use the shortcode like this:
{{< youtube <VIDEO_ID> >}}
Where <VIDEO_ID> is the youtube video ID. For example:
{{< youtube zk9zHqXm6m0 >}}
Which is rendered like this:

You can obtain the video ID by inspecting Youtube’s URLs.
For instance, in this URL, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zk9zHqXm6m0 the video ID is the part after v= in the URL.

title: Vimeo
text:
Vimeo
To embed a Vimeo video in your HTML document use this shortcode:
{{< vimeo <VIDEO_ID> >}}
Where <VIDEO_ID> is the vimeo video ID. For example:
{{< vimeo 22439234 >}}
Which renders like this:
   
You can get the VIDEO ID from for the URL of the video. For instance, in the URL https://vimeo.com/channels/top/22439234 the video ID is 22439234.
